medium: Wood, pigments, lacquer, gofun, gilt metal
title: Shichiguchi
marks:
Inscription

on back of forehead, incised: symbo
text: Shishiguchi and Kojishi represent a pair of lions who serve Manjusri, the Buddhist deity of Wisdom. In the No_ play <I>Shakkyo<I>, the two lions playfully cavort on a stage strewn with peony blossoms. The powerful dance of these heavenly creatures is said to dispel all evil.
description: growling lion/demon face with gold and red skin, very wide nose and gold teeth; large red tongue; upper palate, irises, nostrils and ear canals cut out
